result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Allen Haugland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler Allen Haugland is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyler Allen Haugland was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Tyler Allen Haugland was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 3.
Defendant to report to Probation by 4:00 p.m. April 22, 2016.
Court extends 10 days to attorney's to determine credit against ultimate sentence.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation as the Court defines it.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to maintain employment.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts, Court takes judicial notice of bond in 16CF177. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 in 16CF237. 15CF306 - Count 1 
-12 mos St. Croix County Jail
Count 2 
-9 mos concurrent to Ct. 1
-239 days credit

16CF237 - Count 3 
-10 mos St. Croix County Jail consecutive to 15CF306
-Participate in MRT and AODA program
-Court costs $268
-DNA sample and surcharge $250

Filed by ADA Hartung. Requesting a continuance of 10/6/2015 MH. Hearing reset. km
Pre-signed by SRN and Def. this date.  eif

INCLUDES 15CF250, 15CF306, 15CF319, 15CF342 & 15CF394

-Defendant is permitted to attend his Grandfather's funeral on September 2, 2015. Immediately after the funeral Defendant shall report to Salvation Army Treatment Program.

-Defendant shall be tested upon admission to the program on September 2, 2015. Any positive results shall immediately be reported to the St. Croix County Sheriff.

-Defendant shall remain in Salvation Army Treatment Program.

-Defendant shall be regularly tested during treatment program and any positive results to be reported to St. Croix County Sheriff.

-If Defendant absconds from program or is discharged against staff advise Defendant to report immediately to St. Croix County Jail.

-Defendant to sign a Pre-waiver of extradition before release.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Brandon S., William S., Jeramy V. or J. Stevens.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Tyler Allen Haugland appeared. Case called at 1:46. Includes 15CF250, 15CF342, 15CF306, 15CF319, 15CF394. On 15CF394 Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. On 15CF250 motion hearing regarding initial stop, canine sniff and forcible opening of safe. S/T Deputy Justin Johnson. Direct by ADA Hartung. Deputy Johnson identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Smestad. Court orders the state to provide all discovery, video and all reports from Hudson PD. Motion hearing will be continued. Court addresses furlough request to attend a funeral. Funeral will be Wed. Sept. 2, 2015 in New Richmond. Court authorizes DE release 1 hr. prior to funeral to Mr. Kevin Wittstock once Court is aware of the specific time of the service. Bond will be modified at that time. DE to go to go from jail to the funeral with no stops in between, Mr. Wittstock to attend the funeral with the DE. DE has been accepted to the Salvation Army Program. After funeral Mr. Wittstock to take DE directly to the Salvation Army. There will be no stops along the way, no alcohol, no use of any drugs. Salvation Army to test DE when he arrives and jprovide test results to the SCSO. De to stay in the program and follow all rules of the program. If DE obsconds DE is to report directly back to St. Croix County Jail. If DE tests positive the Salvation Army is to contact the St. Croix County Jail. DE to sign a pre sign waiver of extradition. Court maintains bond on all files with this modification.  Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $4,000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S: Mr. Haugland

Includes 15CF306 and 15CF319

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brandon S. or William S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  Including, but not limited to Facebook, Twitter and Social Media. The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Report every  Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
